name: Semolina Turmeric Cake (Sfoof)
author: Lara
summary: A Lebanese dessert that is not overly sweet. It is pleasing to the American palate due to its lack of rose water and orange blossom essence, found in most Middle Eastern desserts. Sahteyn! (Bon appetit!)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease a 9 inch round baking pan
In a small bowl, mix semolina, flour, turmeric and baking powder
In a large bowl, stir milk and sugar until sugar is dissolved
Add flour mixture and oil and beat with an electric beater at medium speed for 5 minutes
This step is essential, do not use any shortcuts
Pour into a prepared 9 inch round pan
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 to 35 minutes, or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out dry
